choices.C: In Directory Settings, disable Contact Sharing.
choices.A: In the Users list, find the VIPs and turn off the User setting "Directory Sharing."
choices.D: Create separate Custom Directories for the VIPs and regular employees.
choices.B: Create a Group for the VIPs and their handlers, and set the Group Access Level to Restricted.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D: https://support.google.com/a/answer/7566446?hl=en

Selected Answer: D
Users that are assigned a custom directory can find only people in that custom directory. They can find all shared external contacts. They can also find all Groups that are visible to them.
Users in organizational units that aren’t assigned a custom directory can find either:
Everyone in the Directory, if their organizational unit doesn’t inherit a custom directory, or
Only people in a custom directory, if their organizational unit inherits a custom directory from a parent organizational unit.

comments.content: If you turn directory sharing off, they wont be searchable neither for the senior employees, neither by themselves. So best approach is D.

questions.question_text:
Your employer, a media and entertainment company, wants to provision G Suite Enterprise accounts on your domain for several world-famous celebrities.
Leadership is concerned with ensuring that these VIPs are afforded a high degree of privacy. Only a small group of senior employees must be able to look up contact information and initiate collaboration with the VIPs using G Suite services such as Docs, Chat, and Calendar. You are responsible for configuring to meet these requirements.
What should you do?

discussion.content: I would go with B & C, if email address is changed in AD, there shouldn’t be delivery disruption. When the update is done in Gsuit console > Their previous email will become an alternate email (email alias) so email delivery isn't interrupted.

comments.content: typo ... "ADAP" was s'pose to be AD or LDAP - looks like I could not decide. Pick either one, they both correct

discussion.content: GCDS is a one-way sync from ADAP, this link [https://support.google.com/a/answer/7177267] states that GCDS works best if updates to GSuite are done via the sync (i.e. not directly in G Suite) so D and E is correct

questions.question_text:
Your organization syncs directory data from Active Directory to G Suite via Google Cloud Directory Sync. Users and Groups are updated from Active Directory on an hourly basis. A user's last name and primary email address have to be changed. You need to update the user's data.
What two actions should you take? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Change the user's primary email address in the G Suite Admin panel.
choices.A: Add the user's old email address to their account in the G Suite Admin panel.
choices.D: Change the user's primary email in Active Directory.
choices.C: Change the user's last name in the G Suite Admin panel.
choices.E: Change the user's last name in Active Directory.

choices.D: Create a reporting using the API Permissions logs for Installed Apps.
choices.A: Create a report using the OAuth Token Audit Activity logs.
choices.B: Create a report using the Calendar Audit Activity logs.
choices.C: Create a report using the Drive Audit Activity logs.

discussion.content: What would be the correct answer?

comments.content: A, IDK that D even exists https://support.google.com/a/answer/7061566?hl=en

questions.question_text:
Your CISO is concerned about third party applications becoming compromised and exposing G Suite data you have made available to them. How could you provide granular insight into what data third party applications are accessing?
What should you do?

choices.B: Create a Content Compliance rule that looks for outbound share notifications from those two users, and Bcc the Director on those emails.
choices.C: Create two Drive Audit Alerts, one for each user, where the Visibility is "Shared Externally," and email them to the Director.
choices.A: Create a Google Group that has the two auditors as members, and then create a Drive DLP Rule that is assigned to that Group.
choices.D: Check the Admin Console Dashboard Insights page periodically for external shares, and notify the Director of any changes.

questions.question_text:
The Director of your Finance department has asked to be alerted if two financial auditors share any files outside the domain. You need to set an Admin Alert on
Drive Sharing.
What should you do?

comments.content: DLP is for preventing loss, not alerting on it. The Director is being sneaky.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct way to search for the esact term is in quotes ("project 123" and not (project 123)). Ref: https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2474474?hl=en. Also, afeter doing this ytou must create the retention rule using comas to separate user from user.

comments.content: hold all email for two specific users is the key word
I correct my self it should be A as ask is for two different type of hold.

discussion.content: I will go with Option B

questions.question_text:
Your company has been engaged in a lawsuit, and the legal department has been asked to discover and hold all email for two specific users. Additionally, they have been asked to discover and hold any email referencing "Secret Project 123."
What steps should you take to satisfy this request?

choices.B: Create a Matter and a Hold. Set the Hold to Gmail, set it to Accounts, and set the usernames to: user1@your-company.com, user2@your-company. Set the search terms to: (secret project 123). Save.
choices.D: Create a Matter and a Hold. Set the Hold to Gmail, set it to Accounts, and set the usernames to: user1@your-company.com, user2@your-company. Set the search terms to secret OR project OR 123. Save.
choices.C: Create a Matter and a Hold. Set the Hold to Gmail, set it to Accounts, and enter: user1@your-company.com AND user2@your-company.com. Set the search terms to: secret AND project AND 123. Save.
choices.A: Create a Matter and a Hold. Set the Hold to Gmail, set it to the top level Organization, and set the search terms to "secret project 123." Create a second Hold. Set the second Hold to Gmail, set it to Accounts, and enter: user1 @your-company.com, user2@your-company.com. Save.
